intro: Scrophularia calliantha, commonly known as the California spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish to purple flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats. Scrophularia calliantha is an important plant for pollinators and is considered a rare species in some regions.
